South Asia Regional Micro Database (SARMD) User Guidelines South Asia Region Team for Statistical Development (SARTSD) Raúl Andrés Castañeda Aguilar Jayne Jungsun Yoo Francisco Javier Parada Gómez Urquiza 2019-05-08 Welcome This book is about the analysis of household surveys from South Asian countries and is intended to be used as a manual by any researcher interested in using the South Asia Regional Micro Database (SARMD). The household surveys contained in SARMD provide a rich and open source of data on economic behavior and expenditure patterns, demographics, educational attainment, employment, the acquisition of durable assets, and housing. The harmonization of these surveys allows to compare social and economic statistics among the eight countries in the region. These guidelines are intended to teach you everything you need to know to work efficiently with the South Asia Region MicroDatabase (SARMD). You will learn how to get acces to the microdata through the datalibweb system, how to perform basic (and not so basic) socioeconomic calculations, howe comparable and similar household surveys are across the region,how good the harmonization process is, and how to make analysis at the regional or country level by providing a series of case studies and findings. 0.1 About the technical composition of this book This book has been written in Rmarkdown syntax and compiled with the Bookdown package. The source files are available in the Word Bank Github repo DDDD. In order to become a contributor of this project, please send an email to … requesting for access. Once you’re granted for access, you may clone of fork this repo and start contributing. There are several advantages to compose books (specially technical book) using Markdown: You are able to create different types of output formats such as PDF, HTML, WORD, EPub, and even Kindle files. Everything is written using plain text, so you may enjoy the benefits of tracking changes and collaborative platforms as Git. You can execute R or Stata code directly from the text as well as include code chunks and/or its corresponding results inline wherever you want within the document. You can add features like multi-page HTML output, numbering and cross-referencing figures/tables/sections/equations, inserting parts/appendices, and imported GitBook style to create elegant and beautiful books.
